markers yarn needle to weave in ends gauge 5 sts = 1 / 7 row = 1 pattern notes this pattern uses only one skein of yarn and can be easily knitted in a day it s a great blank canvas for displaying fun stitches knit 10 row in 1x1 ribbing k1 p1 hand row 1-­ 5 knit row 6 increase row increase row row 7-­ 8 knit needle 1 knit row 9 increase row needle 2 k10 place marker pm knit through front and row 10-­ 11 knit back loop kfbl you now have 2 sts on the left side of the marker each increase row you kfbl of the first row 12 increase row stitch after slipping the marker increasing one st per row 13-­ 14 knit needle and knit the rest of the stitches to the end of the 2nd needle row 15 increase row needle 3 kfbl pm k10 on the following increase row knit row 16-­ 17 knit until 1 st before the marker and kfbl sm k10 row 18 increase row needle 4 -­ knit row 19-­ 20 knit row 21 increase row row 22-­ 23 knit row 24 you should now have 14 sts 7/needle between the markers knit to the marker place the stitches after the marker on a piece of waste yarn 14 sts total and then rejoin needles 2 and 3 leaving the 14 sts on the piece of waste yarn row 25-­ 29 knit row 30-­ 37 knit 8 row of 1x1 rib k1 p1 row 38 bind of using a stretchy bind off i used the sewn bind off thumb transfer the 14 sts from the waste yarn onto dpns pick up 2 extra stitches at the top of the thumb to close the small gap 16 sts total join and knit in 1x1 rib in the round until desired length bind off sewn bind off -­ using a tapestry needle with an extremely long tail of yarn pull the needle through two front loops as if to purl then back through the first stitch as if to knit drop the first stitch off repeat to the end bacoknitter designs page 2 all pattern elements
